history.proof: intros a b p q s H1 H2 H3. shelve.

ctx: intros a b p q s H1 H2 H3.
exceptions.exn: Found no subterm matching "T2M (A:=A) (n:=n) a" in H2.

ctx: intros a b p q s H1 H2 H3.
exceptions.tactic: apply (plusP_inv2 a b p q s H3).
exceptions.exn: In environment A : Type A0, A1 : A eqA : A -> A -> Prop plusA : A -> A -> A invA : A -> A minusA, multA : A -> A -> A divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A cs : CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec : forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b} n : nat ltM : mon n -> mon n -> Prop ltM_dec : forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b} os : OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n) a, b : Term A n p, q, s : list (Term A n) H1 : eqT (A:=A) (n:=n) a b H2 : zeroP A0 eqA (n:=n) (plusTerm plusA (n:=n) a b) H3 : plusP (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) b q) s Unable to unify "s = pX (A:=A) (n:=n) b (pluspf (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) q)" with "s = pluspf p q".

ctx: intros a b p q s H1 H2 H3.
exceptions.exn: In environment A : Type A0, A1 : A eqA : A -> A -> Prop plusA : A -> A -> A invA : A -> A minusA, multA : A -> A -> A divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A cs : CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec : forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b} n : nat ltM : mon n -> mon n -> Prop ltM_dec : forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b} os : OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n) a, b : Term A n p, q, s : list (Term A n) H1 : eqT (A:=A) (n:=n) a b H2 : zeroP A0 eqA (n:=n) (plusTerm plusA (n:=n) a b) H3 : plusP (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) b q) s Unable to unify "{ltT (A:=A) ltM ?M1742 ?M1743} + {ltT (A:=A) ltM ?M1743 ?M1742} + {eqT (A:=A) (n:=n) ?M1742 ?M1743}" with "s = pluspf p q".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type
A1: A
A0: A
eqA: A -> A -> Prop
plusA: A -> A -> A
invA: A -> A
multA: A -> A -> A
minusA: A -> A -> A
divA: A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A
cs: CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA
eqA_dec: forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b}
n: nat
ltM: mon n -> mon n -> Prop
ltM_dec: forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b}
os: OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n)

Goal:
forall (a b : Term A n) (p q s : list (Term A n)), eqT (A:=A) (n:=n) a b -> zeroP A0 eqA (n:=n) (plusTerm plusA (n:=n) a b) -> plusP (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) b q) s -> s = pluspf p q

Premises:
zeroP : forall A : Type, A -> (A -> A -> Prop) -> forall n : nat, Term A n -> Prop
plusTerm : forall A : Type, (A -> A -> A) -> forall n : nat, Term A n -> Term A n -> Term A n
mult_mon : forall d : nat, mon d -> mon d -> mon d
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
pluspf = fun l1 l2 : list (Term A n) => projsig1 (list (Term A n)) (fun a : list (Term A n) => plusP (fst (l1, l2)) (snd (l1, l2)) a) (plusp (l1, l2)) : list (Term A n) -> list (Term A n) -> list (Term A n) Arguments pluspf (_ _)%list_scope
Inductive plusP : list (Term A n) -> list (Term A n) -> list (Term A n) -> Prop := nillu1 : forall l1 : list (Term A n), plusP (pO A n) l1 l1 | nillu2 : forall l1 : list (Term A n), plusP l1 (pO A n) l1 | mainu1 : forall (a1 a2 : Term A n) (l1 l2 l3 : list (Term A n)), ltT (A:=A) ltM a2 a1 -> plusP l1 (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a2 l2) l3 -> plusP (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a1 l1) (pX (A:=A) (n

pX : forall (A : Type) (n : nat), Term A n -> list (Term A n) -> list (Term A n)

nZero_invTerm_nZero : forall (A : Type) (A0 A1 : A) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop) (plusA : A -> A -> A) (invA : A -> A) (minusA multA : A -> A -> A) (divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A), CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA -> forall (n : nat) (a : Term A n), ~ zeroP A0 eqA (n:=n) a -> ~ zeroP A0 eqA (n:=n) (invTerm invA (n:=n) a)
zeroP_invTerm_zeroP : forall (A : Type) (A0 A1 : A) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop) (plusA : A -> A -> A) (invA : A -> A) (minusA multA : A -> A -> A) (divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A), CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA -> forall (n : nat) (a : Term A n), zeroP A0 eqA (n:=n) a -> zeroP A0 eqA (n:=n) (invTerm invA (n:=n) a)
canonical_cons : forall (A : Type) (A0 : A) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop) (n : nat) (ltM : mon n -> mon n -> Prop) (l : list (Term A n)) (a b : Term A n), ltT (A:=A) ltM b a -> ~ zeroP A0 eqA (n:=n) a -> canonical A0 eqA ltM (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) b l) -> canonical A0 eqA ltM (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) b l))
plusTerm_com : forall (A : Type) (A0 A1 : A) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop) (plusA : A -> A -> A) (invA : A -> A) (minusA multA : A -> A -> A) (divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A), CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA -> forall (n : nat) (x y : Term A n), eqT (A:=A) (n:=n) x y -> eqTerm eqA (n:=n) (plusTerm plusA (n:=n) x y) (plusTerm plusA (n:=n) y x)

```coq
intros a b p q s H1 H2 H3.
rewrite H1 in H2.
apply (plusP_inv2 a b p q s H3).
apply (ltT_dec A n ltM ltM_dec).
```

original: intros a b p q s H1 H2 H3. rewrite H1 in H2. apply (plusP_inv2 a b p q s H3). apply (ltT_dec A n ltM ltM_dec).
